<productRequirementsDocument>
    <title>PRD for Comprehensive Test Project 20251105_113858</title>
    <executiveSummary>Comprehensive Test Project 20251105_113858 is an AI-powered project management platform designed to enhance team productivity through intelligent task management, real-time collaboration, and data-driven insights. The platform leverages artificial intelligence to streamline task creation, provide personalized workload prioritization, and generate actionable project health summaries. With enterprise-grade security including OAuth 2.0 SSO, end-to-end encryption, and comprehensive compliance (GDPR, CCPA, SOC 2), the solution targets modern organizations seeking to optimize their project workflows. Key success metrics include achieving 10,000 active users within 12 months, maintaining 99.9% uptime, and delivering sub-2-second page load times. The platform's competitive advantage lies in its AI-assisted features that reduce cognitive load and accelerate project delivery while maintaining robust security and accessibility standards.</executiveSummary>

    <scope>
        <inScope>
            • AI-powered task creation with natural language parsing and smart suggestions
            • Personalized AI-driven workload and prioritization dashboards
            • Real-time collaborative task management with live updates
            • OAuth 2.0 Single Sign-On integration with major identity providers
            • RESTful API for programmatic report generation and BI integration
            • AI-generated project health summaries with risk identification
            • Role-based access control and permission management
            • Real-time notifications and activity feeds
            • File attachments and comment threading on tasks
            • Mobile-responsive web interface
        </inScope>
        <outOfScope>
            • Native mobile applications (iOS/Android)
            • Advanced time tracking and billing features
            • Resource capacity planning and allocation tools
            • Custom workflow automation builders
            • Advanced Gantt chart visualization
            • Integration with third-party project management tools (Jira, Asana)
            • Advanced reporting templates and customization
            • Video conferencing and screen sharing capabilities
            • Enterprise SAML federation (beyond OAuth 2.0)
            • Multi-currency and international payment processing
        </outOfScope>
        <dependencies>
            <externalServices>
                • OAuth 2.0 identity providers (Google Workspace, Microsoft 365)
                • Cloud hosting provider (AWS/Azure/GCP)
                • Database service (PostgreSQL managed instance)
                • File storage service (S3 or equivalent)
                • Email service provider for notifications (SendGrid/SES)
                • AI/ML platform for natural language processing
                • Monitoring and logging services (DataDog/New Relic)
            </externalServices>
            <prerequisites>
                • Design system approval and brand guidelines
                • Security review and penetration testing
                • Legal compliance review for data privacy
                • OAuth 2.0 client credentials setup with identity providers
                • AI model training and validation
                • CI/CD pipeline configuration
                • Performance testing environment setup
            </prerequisites>
        </dependencies>
        <assumptions>
            • Users have reliable internet connectivity for real-time features
            • Target organizations use supported OAuth 2.0 identity providers
            • AI model can accurately parse natural language task inputs
            • Team sizes range from 5 to 500 users per organization
            • Users have basic familiarity with project management concepts
            • Modern web browsers (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge) are used
            • Sufficient cloud resources can be provisioned for scaling
            • Third-party APIs will maintain their current functionality and pricing
        </assumptions>
        <constraints>
            <technicalConstraints>
                • Browser support limited to last 2 major versions
                • No support for Internet Explorer
                • Maximum file attachment size of 100MB per file
                • API rate limiting of 1000 requests per hour per user
                • Real-time features require WebSocket support
                • AI processing limited to English language initially
            </technicalConstraints>
            <businessConstraints>
                • Development timeline of 12 months for MVP
                • Budget limited to $2M for initial development
                • Must achieve profitability within 24 months
                • Pricing must be competitive with existing solutions
                • Enterprise sales cycle may extend adoption timeline
            </businessConstraints>
            <resourceConstraints>
                • Development team of 15 members maximum
                • Limited AI/ML expertise available internally
                • DevOps team of 3 members for infrastructure
                • QA team of 4 members for testing
                • Customer support team of 5 members for launch
            </resourceConstraints>
        </constraints>
    </scope>

    <businessGoals>
        <primaryObjectives>
            • Launch AI-powered project management platform within 12 months
            • Achieve 10,000 monthly active users within first year
            • Secure 50 enterprise customers with annual contracts
            • Maintain customer satisfaction score above 4.5/5
            • Achieve product-market fit and positive unit economics
        </primaryObjectives>
        <keyPerformanceIndicators>
            <kpi name="user_adoption" target="10,000 users" timeframe="12 months" measurement="monthly active users">
                <description>Track user registration, activation, and monthly active users through analytics platform. Measure user engagement through daily active users and session duration.</description>
            </kpi>
            <kpi name="revenue_target" target="$2.5M ARR" timeframe="24 months" measurement="monthly recurring revenue">
                <description>Monitor subscription revenue, customer acquisition cost, and lifetime value. Track conversion rates from free trial to paid plans.</description>
            </kpi>
            <kpi name="user_retention" target="85% retention" timeframe="12 months" measurement="monthly churn rate">
                <description>Calculate customer churn rate, cohort retention analysis, and user engagement metrics. Monitor feature adoption and usage patterns.</description>
            </kpi>
            <kpi name="feature_adoption" target="70% AI feature usage" timeframe="12 months" measurement="feature usage analytics">
                <description>Track AI-powered task creation rate, dashboard usage, and report generation API calls. Monitor user feedback on AI suggestions accuracy.</description>
            </kpi>
            <kpi name="performance_sla" target="99.9% uptime" timeframe="continuous" measurement="system monitoring">
                <description>Monitor system availability through uptime monitoring services. Track page load times, API response times, and error rates.</description>
            </kpi>
        </keyPerformanceIndicators>
        <successMetrics>
            <metric name="customer_satisfaction" target="4.5+ stars" measurement="CSAT surveys">
                <trackingMethod>Implement Net Promoter Score (NPS) surveys targeting >40, Customer Satisfaction Score (CSAT) >4.5/5, and Customer Effort Score (CES) monitoring. Track support ticket resolution times and user feedback trends.</trackingMethod>
            </metric>
            <metric name="market_share" target="2% market share" timeframe="24 months" measurement="industry benchmarks">
                <description>Monitor market penetration through industry reports, competitive analysis, and customer acquisition in target segments. Track brand awareness and thought leadership metrics.</description>
            </metric>
        </successMetrics>
    </businessGoals>

    <nonFunctionalRequirements>
        <performance>
            <pageLoadTime target="< 2 seconds" measurement="95th percentile">
                <description>Critical pages including dashboard, task views, and login must load within 2 seconds for 95% of users. Measure using real user monitoring (RUM) tools.</description>
            </pageLoadTime>
            <apiResponse target="< 500ms" measurement="99th percentile">
                <description>Core API endpoints for task operations, authentication, and AI suggestions must respond within 500ms for 99% of requests. Monitor API performance continuously.</description>
            </apiResponse>
            <uptime target="99.9%" measurement="monthly availability">
                <description>System must maintain 99.9% uptime excluding scheduled maintenance windows. Implement redundant infrastructure and automatic failover mechanisms.</description>
            </uptime>
            <concurrency target="1000 concurrent users" measurement="load testing">
                <description>System must support 1000 concurrent users per organization with sub-second response times. Conduct quarterly load testing to validate scalability.</description>
            </concurrency>
        </performance>
        <security>
            <authentication target="OAuth 2.0" measurement="SSO support">
                <description>Implement OAuth 2.0 with PKCE for web applications. Support Google Workspace and Microsoft 365 identity providers. Enable multi-factor authentication (MFA).</description>
            </authentication>
            <authorization target="Role-Based Access Control" measurement="RBAC implementation">
                <description>Implement granular role-based permissions for Owner, Admin, Manager, Member, and Viewer roles. Support custom roles and permission inheritance.</description>
            </authorization>
            <dataEncryption target="End-to-End" measurement="AES-256">
                <description>Encrypt data at rest using AES-256 encryption. Encrypt data in transit using TLS 1.3. Implement key rotation policies and secure key management.</description>
            </dataEncryption>
            <compliance target="GDPR, CCPA, SOC 2" measurement="third-party audit">
                <description>Achieve GDPR compliance with data portability and right to deletion. Implement CCPA compliance for California residents. Pursue SOC 2 Type II certification annually.</description>
            </compliance>
        </security>
        <accessibility target="WCAG 2.1 AA" measurement="automated testing + manual review">
            <description>Ensure full keyboard navigation, screen reader compatibility, and color contrast compliance. Conduct quarterly accessibility audits and user testing with assistive technologies.</description>
        </accessibility>
        <internationalization target="English (initial) + 3 more languages" measurement="localization testing">
                <description>Launch with English language support. Plan for Spanish, German, and French localization within 18 months. Implement Unicode support and right-to-left language capability.</description>
        </internationalization>
    </nonFunctionalRequirements>

    <useCases>
        <useCase id="UC-001" name="Create and Manage Tasks with AI Assistance" priority="High">
            <description>A user creates a new task within a project, assigning it to team members, setting due dates, and providing details. The system leverages AI to suggest assignees, due dates, and parse natural language inputs to streamline task creation.</description>
            <primaryActor>Team Member</primaryActor>
            <secondaryActors>Project Manager</secondaryActors>
            <preconditions>User is logged in and has access to the project. The project workspace is open.</preconditions>
            <mainFlow>
                <step number="1">User navigates to the project's task board or list.</step>
                <step number="2">User clicks the 'Add Task' or '+' button.</step>
                <step number="3">User enters a task title in natural language (e.g., 'Finalize Q4 marketing report by Friday').</step>
                <step number="4">AI model parses the input and pre-fills the 'Title' and 'Due Date' fields.</step>
                <step number="5">AI suggests potential assignees based on task content and team roles.</step>
                <step number="6">User reviews AI suggestions, makes any necessary adjustments, and adds a detailed description or attachments.</step>
                <step number="7">User clicks 'Save' or 'Create Task'.</step>
                <step number="8">System validates the data and creates the task.</step>
                <step number="9">The new task appears in real-time on all collaborators' views.</step>
                <step number="10">A notification is sent to the assigned user(s).</step>
            </mainFlow>
            <alternativeFlows>
                <flow id="A1">
                    <description>Manual Task Creation - If the user does not use natural language input, they manually fill in all fields including title, description, assignee, and due date without AI suggestions.</description>
                    <steps>
                        <step number="1">User manually enters task title in designated field.</step>
                        <step number="2">User manually selects assignee from dropdown list.</step>
                        <step number="3">User manually sets due date using date picker.</step>
                        <step number="4">User adds description and attachments as needed.</step>
                        <step number="5">User clicks 'Save' to create task.</step>
                    </steps>
                </flow>
                <flow id="A2">
                    <description>AI Suggestion Rejection - The user can override any AI-suggested assignee or due date and select different options from the available lists.</description>
                    <steps>
                        <step number="1">User reviews AI-suggested assignee.</step>
                        <step number="2">User clicks 'Change' to open assignee selection.</step>
                        <step number="3">User selects different assignee from team list.</step>
                        <step number="4">User reviews AI-suggested due date.</step>
                        <step number="5">User clicks 'Change' to open date picker.</step>
                        <step number="6">User selects different due date.</step>
                        <step number="7">User proceeds with task creation.</step>
                    </steps>
                </flow>
            </alternativeFlows>
            <postconditions>A new task is successfully created and stored in the database. The task is visible to all project members with appropriate permissions. Assigned users are notified.</postconditions>
            <errorPaths>
                <path id="E1">
                    <description>AI parsing fails or returns invalid suggestions</description>
                    <resolution>System falls back to manual input fields and displays error message. User can proceed with manual task creation.</resolution>
                </path>
                <path id="E2">
                    <description>Task creation fails due to validation errors</description>
                    <resolution>System displays specific validation error messages and highlights required fields. User corrects errors and resubmits.</resolution>
                </path>
            </errorPaths>
            <nonFunctionalRequirements>AI response time < 1 second, real-time updates via WebSocket, input validation and sanitization, audit logging for all task changes.</nonFunctionalRequirements>
        </useCase>
        <useCase id="UC-002" name="Receive AI-Powered Workload and Prioritization Insights" priority="High">
            <description>A user views their personalized dashboard to get an AI-generated summary of their tasks, prioritized by urgency and importance. The system provides insights into potential bottlenecks and suggests an optimal order for task completion.</description>
            <primaryActor>Team Member</primaryActor>
            <secondaryActors></secondaryActors>
            <preconditions>User is logged in. The user has been assigned tasks across one or more projects.</preconditions>
            <mainFlow>
                <step number="1">User logs into the application and is directed to their personal dashboard.</step>
                <step number="2">System displays an 'AI Insights' widget.</step>
                <step number="3">The widget lists the top 3-5 prioritized tasks for the day, with a brief rationale for each (e.g., 'High priority due to upcoming deadline and dependency for Team B').</step>
                <step number="4">System provides a visual indicator of the user's current workload (e.g., 'You are at 80% capacity this week').</step>
                <step number="5">User can click on any suggested task to navigate directly to its details.</step>
            </mainFlow>
            <alternativeFlows>
                <flow id="A1">
                    <description>No Tasks Assigned - If the user has no active tasks, the dashboard displays a message indicating a clear schedule and may suggest exploring unassigned tasks or proactive work.</description>
                    <steps>
                        <step number="1">System detects no active tasks for user.</step>
                        <step number="2">Dashboard displays "You have no active tasks" message.</step>
                        <step number="3">System suggests exploring unassigned tasks or proactive work options.</step>
                        <step number="4">User can click suggestions to explore available work.</step>
                    </steps>
                </flow>
            </alternativeFlows>
            <postconditions>The user is equipped with clear, data-driven guidance on how to focus their efforts for maximum productivity.</postconditions>
            <errorPaths>
                <path id="E1">
                    <description>AI insights generation fails</description>
                    <resolution>System displays basic task list without prioritization and shows "AI insights temporarily unavailable" message.</resolution>
                </path>
                <path id="E2">
                    <description>Workload calculation fails</description>
                    <resolution>System displays "Workload information unavailable" and continues to show prioritized tasks.</resolution>
                </path>
            </errorPaths>
            <nonFunctionalRequirements>Dashboard load time < 2 seconds, AI insights refresh every 15 minutes, secure data access controls, responsive design for mobile devices.</nonFunctionalRequirements>
        </useCase>
        <useCase id="UC-003" name="Collaborate in Real-Time on a Task" priority="High">
            <description>Multiple users simultaneously view and interact with a single task's details. This includes adding comments, updating status, attaching files, and seeing each other's changes in real-time, fostering seamless collaboration.</description>
            <primaryActor>Team Member</primaryActor>
            <secondaryActors>Project Manager</secondaryActors>
            <preconditions>Multiple users are logged in. They have the task open in their respective interfaces.</preconditions>
            <mainFlow>
                <step number="1">User A opens a task detail view.</step>
                <step number="2">User B, who is also assigned or following the task, opens the same task detail view.</step>
                <step number="3">User A adds a comment in the discussion thread.</step>
                <step number="4">The comment instantly appears on User B's screen without requiring a refresh.</step>
                <step number="5">User B attaches a file to the task.</step>
                <step number="6">The file attachment is immediately visible to User A.</step>
                <step number="7">User A changes the task status from 'In Progress' to 'Ready for Review'.</step>
                <step number="8">The status change is reflected in real-time for User B and on the main project board for all relevant team members.</step>
            </mainFlow>
            <alternativeFlows>
                <flow id="A1">
                    <description>Intermittent Connectivity - If a user's connection is lost, their changes are queued locally and synchronized with the server once connectivity is restored, with conflict resolution prompts if necessary.</description>
                    <steps>
                        <step number="1">User's internet connection becomes unstable.</step>
                        <step number="2">System detects connection loss and enables offline mode.</step>
                        <step number="3">User continues making changes which are stored locally.</step>
                        <step number="4">Connection is restored.</step>
                        <step number="5">System synchronizes local changes with server.</step>
                        <step number="6">If conflicts exist, system presents resolution options to user.</step>
                    </steps>
                </flow>
            </alternativeFlows>
            <postconditions>All users have a consistent, up-to-date view of the task's state and history. A record of all interactions is saved.</postconditions>
            <errorPaths>
                <path id="E1">
                    <description>WebSocket connection fails</description>
                    <resolution>System falls back to polling every 5 seconds and displays "Real-time updates temporarily unavailable" message.</resolution>
                </path>
                <path id="E2">
                    <description>File upload fails</description>
                    <resolution>System displays error message with retry option. File is not attached until successful upload.</resolution>
                </path>
            </errorPaths>
            <nonFunctionalRequirements>WebSocket connection for real-time updates, conflict resolution for concurrent edits, file upload size limits, audit trail for all changes.</nonFunctionalRequirements>
        </useCase>
        <useCase id="UC-004" name="Authenticate via Single Sign-On (SSO) using OAuth 2.0" priority="High">
            <description>A new or existing user logs into the application using their corporate credentials (e.g., Google Workspace, Microsoft 365) through a secure OAuth 2.0 flow, without needing to create a separate password for this application.</description>
            <primaryActor>User</primaryActor>
            <secondaryActors>System, External Identity Provider</secondaryActors>
            <preconditions>The application is configured with the necessary OAuth 2.0 client credentials for the chosen identity provider.</preconditions>
            <mainFlow>
                <step number="1">User navigates to the application's login page.</step>
                <step number="2">User clicks the 'Login with Google' (or other provider) button.</step>
                <step number="3">Application redirects the user's browser to the Google authentication endpoint.</step>
                <step number="4">User enters their Google credentials (if not already logged in to Google) and consents to share their profile information with the application.</step>
                <step number="5">Google redirects the user back to the application with an authorization code.</step>
                <step number="6">Application's backend securely exchanges the authorization code for an access token.</step>
                <step number="7">System uses the access token to fetch the user's profile information (email, name).</step>
                <step number="8">System authenticates the user and creates a session. If the user is new, a user account is automatically provisioned.</step>
                <step number="9">User is redirected to their application dashboard, now logged in.</step>
            </mainFlow>
            <alternativeFlows>
                <flow id="A1">
                    <description>User Denies Access - If the user denies the consent screen on the identity provider's page, they are redirected back to the application with an error message, and they are not logged in.</description>
                    <steps>
                        <step number="1">User clicks "Deny" on consent screen.</step>
                        <step number="2">Identity provider redirects back with error.</step>
                        <step number="3">Application displays "Access denied" message.</step>
                        <step number="4">User remains on login page with option to try again.</step>
                    </steps>
                </flow>
            </alternativeFlows>
            <postconditions>The user is securely authenticated and has an active session within the application.</postconditions>
            <errorPaths>
                <path id="E1">
                    <description>OAuth token exchange fails</description>
                    <resolution>System displays "Authentication failed" message with option to retry. Logs error for debugging.</resolution>
                </path>
                <path id="E2">
                    <description>Identity provider unavailable</description>
                    <resolution>System displays "Service temporarily unavailable" message and offers alternative login methods if configured.</resolution>
                </path>
            </errorPaths>
            <nonFunctionalRequirements>Secure token storage, session timeout management, CSRF protection, secure redirect URI validation, audit logging for authentication events.</nonFunctionalRequirements>
        </useCase>
        <useCase id="UC-005" name="Generate and Export Project Reports via REST API" priority="Medium">
            <description>A project manager or an external business intelligence (BI) tool programmatically requests a summary report for a specific project by calling a secured REST API endpoint. The system aggregates data and returns it in a structured JSON format.</description>
            <primaryActor>Project Manager</primaryActor>
            <secondaryActors>External System</secondaryActors>
            <preconditions>The actor has a valid API token or is authenticated via OAuth 2.0 with scopes for 'report:read'. The project exists.</preconditions>
            <mainFlow>
                <step number="1">Actor makes an authenticated GET request to an endpoint like `/api/v1/projects/{projectId}/reports`.</step>
                <step number="2">API request includes optional query parameters (e.g., `startDate`, `endDate`, `groupBy=assignee`).</step>
                <step number="3">The system validates the authentication token and the user's permissions to access the project data.</step>
                <step number="4">The backend logic queries the PostgreSQL database for tasks, time logs, and comments within the specified criteria.</step>
                <step number="5">System calculates metrics (e.g., tasks completed, average cycle time, burndown chart data).</step>
                <step number="6">System formats the aggregated data into a JSON object.</step>
                <step number="7">API returns a `200 OK` status with the JSON report in the response body.</step>
            </mainFlow>
            <alternativeFlows>
                <flow id="A1">
                    <description>Invalid Project ID or Permissions - If the project ID is invalid or the user lacks permissions, the API returns a `404 Not Found` or `403 Forbidden` error, respectively.</description>
                    <steps>
                        <step number="1">System validates project ID and finds it invalid.</step>
                        <step number="2">API returns 404 Not Found with error message.</step>
                        <step number="3">OR System validates user permissions and finds insufficient access.</step>
                        <step number="4">API returns 403 Forbidden with error message.</step>
                    </steps>
                </flow>
            </alternativeFlows>
            <postconditions>The requesting actor receives a current, machine-readable report of the project's status.</postconditions>
            <errorPaths>
                <path id="E1">
                    <description>Database query timeout</description>
                    <resolution>API returns 504 Gateway Timeout with retry recommendation. Implements query optimization for large datasets.</resolution>
                </path>
                <path id="E2">
                    <description>Invalid date range parameters</description>
                    <resolution>API returns 400 Bad Request with specific validation error message detailing correct date format.</resolution>
                </path>
            </errorPaths>
            <nonFunctionalRequirements>API response time < 500ms, rate limiting of 1000 requests/hour, comprehensive API documentation, request/response logging, pagination for large datasets.</nonFunctionalRequirements>
        </useCase>
        <useCase id="UC-006" name="Receive AI-Generated Project Health Summary" priority="Medium">
            <description>A project manager views a project-level dashboard that features an AI-generated narrative summary of the project's overall health, highlighting key achievements, potential risks, and recommendations for mitigation.</description>
            <primaryActor>Project Manager</primaryActor>
            <secondaryActors></secondaryActors>
            <preconditions>The project has been active for a sufficient period to generate data (e.g., at least one week).</preconditions>
            <mainFlow>
                <step number="1">Project Manager navigates to the main dashboard for a specific project.</step>
                <step number="2">System displays an 'AI Project Health' widget.</step>
                <step number="3">The widget contains a concise, natural-language summary (e.g., 'Project Alpha is on track. The design phase is 90% complete, a key achievement. However, risk of delay is identified in the development backlog, which is growing by 5 tasks per day. Recommendation: Re-allocate one resource from QA to development to address the bottleneck.').</step>
                <step number="4">Key metrics and trends are visually represented alongside the summary (e.g., chart of task creation vs. completion rate).</step>
                <step number="5">Manager can click on highlighted risks or recommendations to see the underlying data or take action (e.g., re-assign a task).</step>
            </mainFlow>
            <alternativeFlows>
                <flow id="A1">
                    <description>Insufficient Data - If the project is too new, the widget displays a message indicating that the AI is still learning and will provide insights once enough data is collected.</description>
                    <steps>
                        <step number="1">System detects insufficient project data.</step>
                        <step number="2">Widget displays "AI insights require more data" message.</step>
                        <step number="3">System shows basic project metrics without AI analysis.</step>
                        <step number="4">Widget indicates when full insights will be available.</step>
                    </steps>
                </flow>
            </alternativeFlows>
            <postconditions>The Project Manager has a high-level, easily digestible understanding of project status and actionable intelligence.</postconditions>
            <errorPaths>
                <path id="E1">
                    <description>AI analysis fails to generate insights</description>
                    <resolution>System displays "AI analysis temporarily unavailable" and shows basic project metrics without narrative summary.</resolution>
                </path>
                <path id="E2">
                    <description>Risk calculation algorithm fails</description>
                    <resolution>System excludes risk section from summary and continues with other insights. Logs error for investigation.</resolution>
                </path>
            </errorPaths>
            <nonFunctionalRequirements>AI insights refresh every 24 hours, dashboard load time < 3 seconds, secure data aggregation, interactive chart rendering, export functionality for reports.</nonFunctionalRequirements>
        </useCase>
    </useCases>

    <riskAssessment>
        <risk level="High" likelihood="Medium" impact="High">
            <description>AI model accuracy and reliability issues could lead to incorrect task suggestions, prioritization errors, and misleading project health insights, potentially causing project delays and user dissatisfaction.</description>
            <mitigationStrategy>Implement comprehensive AI model testing with diverse datasets. Establish human-in-the-loop validation for critical suggestions. Provide clear indicators when AI confidence is low. Implement continuous monitoring and retraining based on user feedback.</mitigationStrategy>
            <owner>AI/ML Team Lead</owner>
            <status>Open</status>
        </risk>
        <risk level="High" likelihood="Low" impact="High">
            <description>Security breach or data compromise could expose sensitive project data and user credentials, leading to legal liabilities and loss of customer trust.</description>
            <mitigationStrategy>Implement end-to-end encryption, regular security audits, penetration testing, and compliance with GDPR/CCPA/SOC 2. Establish incident response plan and security monitoring. Use OAuth 2.0 with PKCE for authentication.</mitigationStrategy>
            <owner>Security Engineer</owner>
            <status>In Progress</status>
        </risk>
        <risk level="Medium" likelihood="Medium" impact="Medium">
            <description>Real-time collaboration features may not scale effectively under high load, causing performance degradation and poor user experience during peak usage.</description>
            <mitigationStrategy>Implement horizontal scaling with load balancers. Use WebSocket connection pooling and efficient message queuing. Conduct stress testing with simulated high concurrency. Implement fallback to polling when WebSocket fails.</mitigationStrategy>
            <owner>DevOps Engineer</owner>
            <status>Open</status>
        </risk>
        <risk level="Medium" likelihood="High" impact="Medium">
            <description>Third-party dependencies (OAuth providers, AI services) may experience downtime or API changes, affecting core functionality.</description>
            <mitigationStrategy>Implement multiple OAuth provider options. Cache authentication tokens with refresh mechanisms. Monitor third-party service status. Develop fallback authentication methods. Maintain service level agreements with critical vendors.</mitigationStrategy>
            <owner>Backend Lead</owner>
            <status>In Progress</status>
        </risk>
        <risk level="Low" likelihood="Low" impact="High">
            <description>Regulatory compliance changes could require significant architectural modifications to maintain GDPR/CCPA/SOC 2 compliance.</description>
            <mitigationStrategy>Engage legal counsel for compliance monitoring. Implement flexible data governance framework. Design for data portability and right to deletion. Regular compliance audits and documentation updates.</mitigationStrategy>
            <owner>Compliance Officer</owner>
            <status>Open</status>
        </risk>
    </riskAssessment>

    <implementationNotes>
        <technicalStack>Frontend: React 18 with TypeScript, Redux Toolkit, Material-UI. Backend: Node.js with Express, TypeScript, PostgreSQL, Redis for caching. AI/ML: Python with TensorFlow/PyTorch, natural language processing libraries. Infrastructure: AWS/Azure, Docker containers, Kubernetes orchestration.</technicalStack>
        <developmentApproach>Agile methodology with 2-week sprints. Feature-driven development with continuous integration/continuous deployment (CI/CD). Daily stand-ups, sprint planning, and retrospectives. Test-driven development (TDD) for critical components.</developmentApproach>
        <testingStrategy>Unit testing with Jest, integration testing with Supertest, end-to-end testing with Cypress. Performance testing with Artillery, security testing with OWASP ZAP. AI model validation with test datasets. User acceptance testing with beta customers.</testingStrategy>
        <deploymentStrategy>Blue-green deployment with zero-downtime releases. Automated deployment through GitHub Actions. Multi-environment setup (development, staging, production). Database migrations with rollback capability. Monitoring and alerting with DataDog/PagerDuty.</deploymentStrategy>
    </implementationNotes>
    <useCases>
        <useCaseModel>
            <useCase>
                <title>Create and Manage Tasks with AI Assistance</title>
                <primaryActor>Team Member</primaryActor>
                <secondaryActors>
                    <actor>Project Manager</actor>
                </secondaryActors>
                <description>A user creates a new task within a project, assigning it to team members, setting due dates, and providing details. The system leverages AI to suggest assignees, due dates, and parse natural language inputs to streamline task creation.</description>
                <mainFlow>
                    <step>User navigates to the project's task board or list.</step>
                    <step>User clicks the 'Add Task' or '+' button.</step>
                    <step>User enters a task title in natural language.</step>
                    <step>AI model parses the input and pre-fills fields.</step>
                    <step>AI suggests potential assignees based on task content.</step>
                    <step>User reviews AI suggestions and makes adjustments.</step>
                    <step>User clicks 'Save' or 'Create Task'.</step>
                    <step>System validates the data and creates the task.</step>
                    <step>The new task appears in real-time on all collaborators' views.</step>
                    <step>A notification is sent to the assigned user(s).</step>
                </mainFlow>
                <alternativeFlows>
                    <flow id="A1" trigger="User chooses manual input">
                        <step>User manually fills in all fields without AI suggestions.</step>
                    </flow>
                    <flow id="A2" trigger="User rejects AI suggestions">
                        <step>User overrides AI-suggested assignee or due date.</step>
                        <step>User selects different options from available lists.</step>
                    </flow>
                </alternativeFlows>
                <exceptionFlows>
                    <flow id="E1" trigger="AI parsing fails">
                        <step>System falls back to manual input fields.</step>
                        <step>System displays error message.</step>
                    </flow>
                    <flow id="E2" trigger="Task creation validation fails">
                        <step>System displays specific validation error messages.</step>
                        <step>System highlights required fields.</step>
                    </flow>
                </exceptionFlows>
            </useCase>
        </useCaseModel>
    </useCases>
    <nonFunctionalRequirements>
        <requirement type="Security">All sensitive data must be encrypted at rest and in transit using AES-256 encryption and TLS 1.3 protocols.</requirement>
        <requirement type="Performance">The system must respond to 95% of user queries in under 2 seconds and 99% of API calls in under 500ms.</requirement>
        <requirement type="Accessibility">The application must comply with WCAG 2.1 AA standards, including full keyboard navigation and screen reader support.</requirement>
        <requirement type="Scalability">The system must support 1000 concurrent users with automatic horizontal scaling capabilities.</requirement>
        <requirement type="Reliability">The system must maintain 99.9% uptime with automatic failover and redundancy mechanisms.</requirement>
        <requirement type="Compliance">The system must comply with GDPR, CCPA, and SOC 2 Type II requirements for data protection and privacy.</requirement>
    </nonFunctionalRequirements>
</productRequirementsDocument>
data.prd_html:
PRD: Comprehensive Test Project 20251105_113858

AI-Powered Project Management Platform

Table of Contents

Executive Summary Scope Business Goals Non-Functional Requirements Use Cases Risk Assessment Implementation Notes

Executive Summary

Comprehensive Test Project 20251105_113858 is an AI-powered project management platform designed to enhance team productivity through intelligent task management, real-time collaboration, and data-driven insights. The platform leverages artificial intelligence to streamline task creation, provide personalized workload prioritization, and generate actionable project health summaries.


With enterprise-grade security including OAuth 2.0 SSO, end-to-end encryption, and comprehensive compliance (GDPR, CCPA, SOC 2), the solution targets modern organizations seeking to optimize their project workflows.


10,000
Active Users Target
99.9%
Uptime Goal
< 2s
Page Load Time

Scope

In Scope

  • AI-powered task creation with natural language parsing
  • Personalized AI-driven workload dashboards
  • Real-time collaborative task management
  • OAuth 2.0 Single Sign-On integration
  • RESTful API for BI integration
  • AI-generated project health summaries
  • Role-based access control
  • Real-time notifications
  • File attachments and comments
  • Mobile-responsive interface

Out of Scope

  • Native mobile applications
  • Advanced time tracking and billing
  • Resource capacity planning
  • Custom workflow automation
  • Advanced Gantt charts
  • Third-party integrations
  • Advanced reporting templates
  • Video conferencing
  • Enterprise SAML federation
  • Multi-currency payments

Dependencies

External Services

  • OAuth 2.0 identity providers
  • Cloud hosting (AWS/Azure/GCP)
  • PostgreSQL database
  • S3 file storage
  • Email service (SendGrid/SES)
  • AI/ML platform
  • Monitoring services

Prerequisites

  • Design system approval
  • Security review
  • Legal compliance review
  • OAuth 2.0 setup
  • AI model training
  • CI/CD pipeline
  • Performance testing

Assumptions & Constraints

Assumptions

  • Reliable internet connectivity
  • OAuth 2.0 provider support
  • AI model accuracy
  • Team sizes 5-500 users
  • Basic PM familiarity
  • Modern browser support
  • Sufficient cloud resources
  • Stable third-party APIs

Constraints

  • Browser: Last 2 versions only
  • No IE support
  • Max file: 100MB
  • API limit: 1000 req/hour
  • WebSocket required
  • English only initially
  • Timeline: 12 months MVP
  • Budget: $2M max

Business Goals

Primary Objectives

  • Launch AI-powered platform within 12 months
  • Achieve 10,000 monthly active users in first year
  • Secure 50 enterprise customers with annual contracts
  • Maintain customer satisfaction > 4.5/5
  • Achieve product-market fit and positive unit economics

Key Performance Indicators

10,000 users
User Adoption
Monthly active users within 12 months
$2.5M ARR
Revenue Target
Within 24 months
85% retention
User Retention
Monthly churn rate
70% usage
Feature Adoption
AI feature usage rate

Success Metrics

Customer Satisfaction

Target: 4.5+ stars

  • Net Promoter Score > 40
  • CSAT > 4.5/5
  • Customer Effort Score monitoring
  • Support ticket resolution tracking

Market Share

Target: 2% within 24 months

  • Industry benchmark monitoring
  • Competitive analysis
  • Customer acquisition tracking
  • Brand awareness metrics

Non-Functional Requirements

Performance

  • Page Load: < 2 seconds (95th percentile)
  • API Response: < 500ms (99th percentile)
  • Uptime: 99.9% monthly availability
  • Concurrency: 1000 concurrent users

Security

  • Authentication: OAuth 2.0 with PKCE
  • Authorization: Role-Based Access Control
  • Encryption: AES-256 at rest, TLS 1.3 in transit
  • Compliance: GDPR, CCPA, SOC 2

Accessibility

  • WCAG 2.1 AA compliance
  • Full keyboard navigation
  • Screen reader compatibility
  • Color contrast compliance
  • Quarterly accessibility audits

Internationalization

  • English (initial launch)
  • Spanish, German, French (18 months)
  • Unicode support
  • Right-to-left language capability

Use Cases

UC-001

Create and Manage Tasks with AI Assistance

High Priority

Primary Actor: Team Member

Description: A user creates a new task within a project, assigning it to team members, setting due dates, and providing details. The system leverages AI to suggest assignees, due dates, and parse natural language inputs.

Main Flow

1
User navigates to the project's task board or list.
2
User clicks the 'Add Task' or '+' button.
3
User enters a task title in natural language.
4
AI model parses the input and pre-fills fields.
5
AI suggests potential assignees based on task content.
6
User reviews AI suggestions and makes adjustments.
7
User clicks 'Save' or 'Create Task'.
8
System validates the data and creates the task.
9
The new task appears in real-time on all collaborators' views.
10
A notification is sent to the assigned user(s).
UC-002

Receive AI-Powered Workload Insights

High Priority

Primary Actor: Team Member

Description: A user views their personalized dashboard to get an AI-generated summary of their tasks, prioritized by urgency and importance.

Main Flow

1
User logs into the application and is directed to their personal dashboard.
2
System displays an 'AI Insights' widget.
3
The widget lists the top 3-5 prioritized tasks for the day.
4
System provides a visual indicator of the user's current workload.
5
User can click on any suggested task to navigate directly to its details.
UC-003

Collaborate in Real-Time on a Task

High Priority

Primary Actor: Team Member

Description: Multiple users simultaneously view and interact with a single task's details, including adding comments, updating status, and attaching files.

Main Flow

1
User A opens a task detail view.
2
User B opens the same task detail view.
3
User A adds a comment in the discussion thread.
4
The comment instantly appears on User B's screen.
5
User B attaches a file to the task.
6
The file attachment is immediately visible to User A.
7
User A changes the task status.
8
The status change is reflected in real-time for User B.
UC-004

Authenticate via SSO using OAuth 2.0

High Priority

Primary Actor: User

Description: A user logs into the application using their corporate credentials through a secure OAuth 2.0 flow.

Main Flow

1
User navigates to the application's login page.
2
User clicks the 'Login with Google' button.
3
Application redirects to Google authentication endpoint.
4
User enters credentials and consents to share profile information.
5
Google redirects back with an authorization code.
6
Backend exchanges code for access token.
7
System fetches user profile information.
8
System authenticates user and creates session.
9
User is redirected to dashboard, now logged in.
UC-005

Generate Project Reports via REST API

Medium Priority

Primary Actor: Project Manager

Description: A project manager or external BI tool programmatically requests a summary report by calling a secured REST API endpoint.

Main Flow

1
Actor makes authenticated GET request to API endpoint.
2
Request includes optional query parameters.
3
System validates authentication and permissions.
4
Backend queries database for project data.
5
System calculates metrics and aggregations.
6
Data is formatted into JSON object.
7
API returns 200 OK with JSON report.
UC-006

Receive AI-Generated Project Health Summary

Medium Priority

Primary Actor: Project Manager

Description: A project manager views a project-level dashboard with an AI-generated narrative summary of project health.

Main Flow

1
Project Manager navigates to project dashboard.
2
System displays 'AI Project Health' widget.
3
Widget contains natural-language summary with insights.
4
Key metrics and trends are visually represented.
5
Manager can click on risks to see underlying data.

Risk Assessment

High Risk

AI Model Accuracy

Likelihood: Medium | Impact: High

AI model accuracy issues could lead to incorrect suggestions and user dissatisfaction.

Mitigation: Comprehensive testing, human-in-the-loop validation, continuous monitoring and retraining.

Owner: AI/ML Team Lead | Status: Open

High Risk

Security Breach

Likelihood: Low | Impact: High

Data compromise could expose sensitive information and cause legal liabilities.

Mitigation: End-to-end encryption, security audits, penetration testing, compliance measures.

Owner: Security Engineer | Status: In Progress

Medium Risk

Scalability Issues

Likelihood: Medium | Impact: Medium

Real-time features may not scale under high load, causing performance degradation.

Mitigation: Horizontal scaling, load balancers, WebSocket pooling, stress testing.

Owner: DevOps Engineer | Status: Open

Medium Risk

Third-Party Dependencies

Likelihood: High | Impact: Medium

External services may experience downtime or API changes affecting functionality.

Mitigation: Multiple provider options, token caching, service monitoring, fallback methods.

Owner: Backend Lead | Status: In Progress

Low Risk

Regulatory Changes

Likelihood: Low | Impact: High

Compliance changes could require significant architectural modifications.

Mitigation: Legal counsel monitoring, flexible governance framework, regular audits.

Owner: Compliance Officer | Status: Open

Implementation Notes

Technical Stack

  • Frontend: React 18, TypeScript, Redux Toolkit, Material-UI
  • Backend: Node.js, Express, TypeScript, PostgreSQL, Redis
  • AI/ML: Python, TensorFlow/PyTorch, NLP libraries
  • Infrastructure: AWS/Azure, Docker, Kubernetes

Development Approach

  • Agile methodology with 2-week sprints
  • Feature-driven development
  • Continuous integration/continuous deployment
  • Daily stand-ups, sprint planning, retrospectives
  • Test-driven development for critical components

Testing Strategy

  • Unit Testing: Jest
  • Integration Testing: Supertest
  • E2E Testing: Cypress
  • Performance Testing: Artillery
  • Security Testing: OWASP ZAP
  • User Acceptance: Beta customer testing

Deployment Strategy

  • Blue-green deployment with zero-downtime
  • Automated deployment via GitHub Actions
  • Multi-environment setup (dev, staging, prod)
  • Database migrations with rollback capability
  • Monitoring and alerting with DataDog/PagerDuty

<systemArchitecture>
    <description>A comprehensive AI-powered project management and task collaboration platform. The architecture follows a microservices pattern with real-time capabilities, AI/ML integration for task creation and prioritization, and scalable cloud-native components. The system supports natural language processing, real-time collaboration, workload analytics, and intelligent task management with WebSocket-based live updates and event-driven architecture.</description>
    <diagram type="mermaid-flowchart">
        <![CDATA[
            graph TD
                %% Frontend Layer
                subgraph "Client Applications"
                    A[React Web App] -->|HTTPS/WSS| B[API Gateway - Kong/Nginx]
                    A2[React Native Mobile App] -->|HTTPS/WSS| B
                    A3[Desktop App - Electron] -->|HTTPS/WSS| B
                end

                %% API Gateway & CDN
                subgraph "Edge Layer"
                    B -->|JWT Auth| C[Authentication Service]
                    B -->|Rate Limiting| D[Load Balancer]
                    E[CloudFlare CDN] -->|Static Assets| A
                    E -->|Static Assets| A2
                    E -->|Static Assets| A3
                end

                %% Real-time Communication
                subgraph "Real-time Layer"
                    F[WebSocket Gateway - Socket.io] -->|WSS| A
                    F -->|WSS| A2
                    F -->|WSS| A3
                    F --> G[Real-time Service]
                end

                %% Core Microservices
                subgraph "Backend Services"
                    C --> H[(PostgreSQL - Auth)]
                    B --> I[User Management Service]
                    B --> J[Project Management Service]
                    B --> K[Task Management Service]
                    B --> L[AI/ML Service]
                    B --> M[Analytics Service]
                    B --> N[Notification Service]
                    B --> O[File Management Service]
                    
                    %% Service Communications
                    K -->|Events| P[Message Queue - RabbitMQ]
                    L -->|AI Insights| K
                    L -->|Prioritization| M
                    G -->|Real-time Updates| K
                    G -->|Live Collaboration| J
                end

                %% AI/ML Pipeline
                subgraph "AI/ML Infrastructure"
                    L --> Q[NLP Processing Engine]
                    L --> R[ML Model Server - TensorFlow]
                    L --> S[(Vector Database - Pinecone)]
                    Q --> T[OpenAI API / Local LLM]
                    R --> U[Model Training Pipeline]
                end

                %% Data Layer
                subgraph "Data Storage"
                    I --> V[(PostgreSQL - User Data)]
                    J --> W[(PostgreSQL - Projects)]
                    K --> X[(PostgreSQL - Tasks)]
                    M --> Y[(ClickHouse - Analytics)]
                    O --> Z[Cloud Storage - S3/MinIO]
                    AA[(Redis Cache)] -->|Session| C
                    AA -->|Cache| K
                    AA -->|Cache| M
                end

                %% Background Processing
                subgraph "Async Processing"
                    P --> AB[Notification Worker]
                    P --> AC[Analytics Worker]
                    P --> AD[AI Processing Worker]
                    P --> AE[Email Service - SendGrid]
                    P --> AF[Push Notification Service]
                end

                %% External Integrations
                subgraph "External Services"
                    AG[OAuth Providers] --> C
                    AH[Slack API] --> N
                    AI[Teams API] --> N
                    AJ[Calendar API] --> K
                    AK[Webhook Endpoints] --> B
                end

                %% Monitoring & Observability
                subgraph "Monitoring Stack"
                    AL[Prometheus] --> AM[Grafana Dashboard]
                    AN[ELK Stack] --> AO[Log Analysis]
                    AP[Jaeger Tracing] --> AQ[Distributed Tracing]
                    AR[Health Checks] --> B
                end

                %% Data Flow Annotations
                %% User Authentication Flow
                A -->|1. Login Request| C
                C -->|2. JWT Token| A
                A -->|3. Authenticated Request| B

                %% Task Creation with AI Flow
                A -->|4. Natural Language Task| K
                K -->|5. AI Processing Request| L
                L -->|6. NLP Analysis| Q
                Q -->|7. Parsed Data| K
                K -->|8. Create Task| X

                %% Real-time Collaboration Flow
                A -->|9. Task Update| G
                G -->|10. Broadcast| F
                F -->|11. Push Update| A2
        ]]>
    </diagram>
    <componentBreakdown>
        <component name="React Web App">Progressive Web Application built with React 18, TypeScript, and Tailwind CSS, featuring offline capabilities and responsive design for desktop and tablet users.</component>
        <component name="React Native Mobile App">Cross-platform mobile application using React Native with Expo, providing native iOS and Android experiences with push notifications and offline sync.</component>
        <component name="Desktop App - Electron">Cross-platform desktop application built with Electron, offering native file system access and desktop notifications for power users.</component>
        <component name="API Gateway - Kong/Nginx">High-performance API gateway handling routing, rate limiting, SSL termination, JWT validation, and service discovery with plugin architecture.</component>
        <component name="Authentication Service">OAuth 2.0 and OpenID Connect compliant service using Passport.js, supporting SSO, MFA, and social login integrations.</component>
        <component name="WebSocket Gateway - Socket.io">Real-time communication layer enabling live collaboration, instant notifications, and bidirectional messaging with fallback mechanisms.</component>
        <component name="Real-time Service">Manages WebSocket connections, room-based subscriptions, and event broadcasting for real-time collaboration features.</component>
        <component name="User Management Service">Handles user profiles, preferences, permissions, and team management with role-based access control (RBAC).</component>
        <component name="Project Management Service">Core service for project creation, workspace management, team collaboration, and project-level analytics.</component>
        <component name="Task Management Service">Primary service for CRUD operations on tasks, status tracking, dependencies, and task relationships with optimistic locking.</component>
        <component name="AI/ML Service">Intelligent service providing natural language processing, task prioritization, workload analysis, and smart suggestions using machine learning models.</component>
        <component name="Analytics Service">Data aggregation and insights service generating workload metrics, productivity analytics, and predictive insights using time-series data.</component>
        <component name="Notification Service">Multi-channel notification system supporting in-app, email, push, and webhook notifications with user preference management.</component>
        <component name="File Management Service">Handles file uploads, storage, versioning, and sharing with virus scanning and thumbnail generation capabilities.</component>
        <component name="NLP Processing Engine">Natural Language Processing component for parsing task descriptions, extracting entities, dates, and intent using spaCy or similar libraries.</component>
        <component name="ML Model Server - TensorFlow">TensorFlow Serving or TorchServe deployment for ML models providing task prioritization and workload predictions.</component>
        <component name="Vector Database - Pinecone">Vector similarity search database for semantic search, task recommendations, and AI-powered content discovery.</component>
        <component name="OpenAI API / Local LLM">Large Language Model integration for advanced natural language understanding and generation, with fallback to local models.</component>
        <component name="Model Training Pipeline">Automated ML pipeline using MLflow for model training, versioning, and deployment with continuous retraining on new data.</component>
        <component name="PostgreSQL">Primary relational database with partitioning, full-text search, and JSONB support for structured application data.</component>
        <component name="ClickHouse">Columnar database for analytics and time-series data, enabling fast aggregations and complex analytical queries.</component>
        <component name="Cloud Storage - S3/MinIO">Object storage for files, attachments, and backups with lifecycle policies and CDN integration.</component>
        <component name="Redis Cache">In-memory data store for session management, caching, rate limiting, and real-time data structures.</component>
        <component name="Message Queue - RabbitMQ">Reliable message broker for asynchronous processing, event-driven architecture, and service decoupling with dead letter queues.</component>
        <component name="Notification Worker">Background service processing notification queues, handling retries, and managing delivery across multiple channels.</component>
        <component name="Analytics Worker">Async worker for processing analytics events, updating dashboards, and generating reports.</component>
        <component name="AI Processing Worker">Background service for heavy AI/ML computations, model inference, and batch processing of AI tasks.</component>
        <component name="Email Service - SendGrid">Transactional email service with templates, analytics, and delivery optimization for email notifications.</component>
        <component name="Push Notification Service">Cross-platform push notification service using Firebase Cloud Messaging and Apple Push Notification Service.</component>
        <component name="OAuth Providers">Third-party identity providers including Google, Microsoft, GitHub, and custom SAML providers.</component>
        <component name="Slack API/Teams API">Integration services for syncing tasks, notifications, and status updates with popular collaboration platforms.</component>
        <component name="Calendar API">Integration with Google Calendar and Outlook for task scheduling and deadline synchronization.</component>
        <component name="CloudFlare CDN">Content Delivery Network for static assets, DDoS protection, and global edge caching.</component>
        <component name="Prometheus">Metrics collection and monitoring system with custom exporters for application and infrastructure metrics.</component>
        <component name="Grafana Dashboard">Visualization platform for monitoring dashboards, alerting, and system health observability.</component>
        <component name="ELK Stack">Centralized logging solution with Elasticsearch, Logstash, and Kibana for log aggregation and analysis.</component>
        <component name="Jaeger Tracing">Distributed tracing system for monitoring and troubleshooting microservices interactions.</component>
    </componentBreakdown>
</systemArchitecture>

Calendar API

CloudFlare CDN

Content Delivery Network for static assets, DDoS protection, and global edge caching.

Prometheus

Metrics collection and monitoring system with custom exporters for application and infrastructure metrics.

Grafana Dashboard

Visualization platform for monitoring dashboards, alerting, and system health observability.

ELK Stack

Centralized logging solution with Elasticsearch, Logstash, and Kibana for log aggregation and analysis.

Jaeger Tracing

Distributed tracing system for monitoring and troubleshooting microservices interactions.

AICOE

Advanced Intelligence & Cloud Operations Excellence

test_cases.test_strategy: ### **1. Test Strategy Overview** This document outlines a comprehensive testing strategy for the Comprehensive Test Project 20251105_113858. Our approach is risk-based and value-driven, aligning directly with the business objectives outlined in the project's use cases. The primary goal is to ensure the delivery of a high-quality, reliable, and intuitive application that enhances team productivity and project management through intelligent automation. **Testing Approach:** We will employ a multi-layered testing strategy, progressing from isolated component validation to holistic end-to-end scenarios. This includes: *   **Unit Testing:** To validate the core logic of individual components, such as AI parsing algorithms and data validation functions. *   **Integration Testing:** To ensure seamless interaction between front-end, back-end, databases, AI services, and third-party systems like identity providers. *   **System Testing:** To verify that the entire application meets all functional and non-functional requirements from a user's perspective. *   **User Acceptance Testing (UAT):** To confirm that the system provides significant business value and meets the expectations of actual users (Team Members, Project Managers). *   **Performance Testing:** To ensure the application remains responsive and stable under expected and peak load conditions. *   **Security Testing:** To safeguard user data and protect against common vulnerabilities, with a special focus on authentication and API security. **Key Focus Areas:** *   **AI Feature Validation:** Rigorously test the accuracy, helpfulness, and reliability of AI-powered suggestions for task creation, prioritization, and project health summaries. *   **Real-Time Collaboration:** Ensure the real-time features are robust, consistent, and provide a seamless collaborative experience. *   **Authentication & Authorization:** Validate the security and integrity of the SSO implementation and role-based access control across the application. *   **API Functionality & Security:** Ensure the reporting API is reliable, performs well, and is secure against unauthorized access. This strategy is designed to provide confidence in the system's quality, ensuring it delivers on its promise of streamlining project management and enhancing team productivity. ---

test_environment.* **Development Environment: ** For initial unit and integration testing by developers.
test_environment.* **QA/Staging Environment: ** A production-like mirror for formal system, integration, UAT, performance, and security testing cycles.
test_environment.* **Production Environment: ** The live environment, monitored for quality post-release.
test_environment.* Browsers for Testing: Latest stable versions of Chrome, Firefox, Safari, and Edge.
test_environment.* Application Server: Node.js, Python (Django/Flask), or Java (Spring Boot) as per the application stack.
test_environment.* **AI Service: ** A sandboxed or staging endpoint for the AI model.
test_environment.* **Identity Provider (IdP): ** Test configurations for Google Workspace and Microsoft 365 OAuth 2.0 flows.
test_environment.* **Notification Service: ** A test instance of the email/push notification service (e.g., SendGrid test mode).
test_environment.* **Network: ** Simulated network conditions (e.g., using throttling tools) to test intermittent connectivity scenarios.
test_environment.* **Database: ** A sanitized copy of the production database schema, populated with synthetic test data.
test_environment.* **API Tokens: ** Valid and expired API tokens for testing the reporting endpoint.

system_test_cases.objective: Verify A user views their personalized dashboard to get an AI-generated summary of their tasks, prioritized by urgency and importance. The system provides insights into potential bottlenecks and suggests an optimal order for task completion.
system_test_cases.preconditions: User is authenticated and system is available

system_test_cases.objective: Verify Multiple users simultaneously view and interact with a single task's details. This includes adding comments, updating status, attaching files, and seeing each other's changes in real-time, fostering seamless collaboration.
system_test_cases.preconditions: User is authenticated and system is available

system_test_cases.preconditions: User is authenticated and system is available

system_test_cases.objective: Verify A project manager or an external business intelligence (BI) tool programmatically requests a summary report for a specific project by calling a secured REST API endpoint. The system aggregates data and returns it in a structured JSON format.
system_test_cases.preconditions: User is authenticated and system is available

system_test_cases.preconditions: User is authenticated and system is available

Test Strategy Overview

### **1. Test Strategy Overview** This document outlines a comprehensive testing strategy for the Comprehensive Test Project 20251105_113858. Our approach is risk-based and value-driven, aligning directly with the business objectives outlined in the project's use cases. The primary goal is to ensure the delivery of a high-quality, reliable, and intuitive application that enhances team productivity and project management through intelligent automation. **Testing Approach:** We will employ a multi-layered testing strategy, progressing from isolated component validation to holistic end-to-end scenarios. This includes: * **Unit Testing:** To validate the core logic of individual components, such as AI parsing algorithms and data validation functions. * **Integration Testing:** To ensure seamless interaction between front-end, back-end, databases, AI services, and third-party systems like identity providers. * **System Testing:** To verify that the entire application meets all functional and non-functional requirements from a user's perspective. * **User Acceptance Testing (UAT):** To confirm that the system provides significant business value and meets the expectations of actual users (Team Members, Project Managers). * **Performance Testing:** To ensure the application remains responsive and stable under expected and peak load conditions. * **Security Testing:** To safeguard user data and protect against common vulnerabilities, with a special focus on authentication and API security. **Key Focus Areas:** * **AI Feature Validation:** Rigorously test the accuracy, helpfulness, and reliability of AI-powered suggestions for task creation, prioritization, and project health summaries. * **Real-Time Collaboration:** Ensure the real-time features are robust, consistent, and provide a seamless collaborative experience. * **Authentication & Authorization:** Validate the security and integrity of the SSO implementation and role-based access control across the application. * **API Functionality & Security:** Ensure the reporting API is reliable, performs well, and is secure against unauthorized access. This strategy is designed to provide confidence in the system's quality, ensuring it delivers on its promise of streamlining project management and enhancing team productivity. ---

**2.1. Environment Tiers**
* **Development Environment** For initial unit and integration testing by developers.
* **QA/Staging Environment** A production-like mirror for formal system, integration, UAT, performance, and security testing cycles.
* **Production Environment** The live environment, monitored for quality post-release.

* **Frontend**
* Web ServerNginx or Apache
* Browsers for TestingLatest stable versions of Chrome, Firefox, Safari, and Edge.
* **Backend**
* Application ServerNode.js, Python (Django/Flask), or Java (Spring Boot) as per the application stack.
* DatabasePostgreSQL version matching production.
* **External Services & Integrations**
* **AI Service** A sandboxed or staging endpoint for the AI model.
* **Identity Provider (IdP)** Test configurations for Google Workspace and Microsoft 365 OAuth 2.0 flows.
* **Notification Service** A test instance of the email/push notification service (e.g., SendGrid test mode).
* **Network** Simulated network conditions (e.g., using throttling tools) to test intermittent connectivity scenarios.

* **Project Data**
* **API Tokens** Valid and expired API tokens for testing the reporting endpoint.
